about.title: About Me
about.description: My name is Francisco González Urriola, but my friends call me Pancho. I wrote my first lines of code in a robotics workshop using Python when I was 12. Since then, I've made steady progress and am now in my third year of the Computer Engineering program at the University of Chile.
about.description1: As part of my journey, I've been advancing in Software Engineering and Web Application Development, gaining the knowledge and tools needed to apply my skills in real-world projects. Below, you can find some of my work.

project1.title: DCCPlaces
project1.description: A platform for reserving spaces within the Department of Computer Science, developed as part of a team using Python and the Django framework. Currently, the repository is private.

project2.title: Gym Data Project
project2.description: Data analysis platform for gyms using FastAPI, PostgreSQL, and React. Features an interactive dashboard with metrics extracted from SQL queries. Frontend hosted on Vercel and backend on Render.

project3.title: Mallas FCFM - fgonzalezurriola
project3.description: A web application that displays the study plans of the programs offered at the University of Chile, built with React, Tailwind CSS and TypeScript.

project4.title: Chilean Birds
project4.description: A simple project where you cand find cards of the chilean birds. Built using React, Tailwind, Axios and Express that uses the API https://aves.ninjas.cl/api/birds with information of the birds from chile

project5.title: Portfolio
project5.description: The portfolio you're currently viewing, featuring dark mode and multi-language support, built with React, Tailwind CSS and TypeScript.

project6.title: Rust Playground
project6.description: A web application that allows users to write, compile, and run Rust code in the browser, featuring basic examples. Built with React, Tailwind CSS, TypeScript and the Rust Playground API.
